pageContext.claim: “We have so many people running. We have a lot of chairmen because they were chairman for 6 years and then they don't want to stay because they can't be chairman. The Democrats, you can be a chairman for 40 years, so you know.”
pageContext.analysis: The entire House of Representatives is up for reelection every two years. It has nothing to do with being a chairman of a committee or not. Plus, there are no term limits on being a chairperson.  Aside from losing their seat, parties and internal politics decide how or when a chairman is removed.
